required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Local Clinical Study for the Comparative Evaluation of Efficacy and Safety of Angal, Lozenges [Menthol] and ANTI-ANGIN® FORMULA, Lozenges, in Treatment of Patients With a Sore Throat
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multi-center, Open, Randomized Clinical Study in Parallel Groups, for the Comparative Evaluation of Efficacy and Safety of Angal, Lozenges [Menthol], 1 mg + 5 mg (Sandoz d.d., Slovenia), and ANTI-ANGIN® FORMULA, Lozenges, 0,2 mg + 2 mg + 50 mg (LLC "Valeant", Russia) in Treatment of Patients With Uncomplicated Acute Infectious and Inflammatory Diseases of the Pharynx, Accompanied by a Sore Throat.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to evaluate no less therapeutic efficacy and safety of the Angal, lozenges [Menthol], 1 mg + 5 mg (Sandoz dd, Slovenia) compared to ANTI-ANGIN® FORMULA, lozenges, 0,2 mg + 2 mg + 50 mg (LLC "Valeant", Russia) in treatment of patients with uncomplicated acute infectious and inflammatory diseases of the pharynx, accompanied by a sore throat.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Without Sore Throat According to TSS Score

secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of 50 % or more total score reduction by the TSS questionnaire completed by the Investigator relative to baseline in both Angal and ANTI-ANGIN FORMULA arms at visit 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in TSS Total Score
Days to Recovery, Defined by the Patient's Diary (Subjective Evaluation by the Patient)
secondary_outcome.description: only patients for which outcomes were available were included , 111 out of 113 for Angal and 102 out of 107 for Antiangin, per protocol set

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Fully Recovered up to Day 5
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days for Angal, 5 days for AntiAngin
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who fully recovered up to day 5 (the outcome of a disease according to the objective evaluation by the Investigator, the total score according to the TSS questionnaire ≤ 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Sore Throat Intensity by 100 mm in Visual Analogue Scale Filled in by the Patient (VAS) .
secondary_outcome.description: The VAS is a 100-mm horizontal line on which the patient's pain intensity is represented by a point between the extremes of "no pain at all" and "worst pain imaginable." The VAS ranges from 0 to 100. A decrease from baseline in the VAS score to reflect pain intensity indicates a decrease in pain intensity.

arm_group.description: Angal, lozenges, per 1 lozenge, with an interval 2 hours or more, 6-10 lozenges per day, for a maximum 4 days or until full illness resolution, if this will happen earlier than 4th day of treatment.

ANTIANGIN ® FORMULA, 1 lozenge, with an interval 2 hours or more, up to 6 lozenges per day, for a maximum 5 days or until full illness resolution, if this will happen earlier than 5th day of treatment.

intervention.description: Angal, administered per 1 lozenge, with an interval 2 hours or more, 6-10 lozenges per day, for a maximum 4 days or until full illness resolution.
0,2 mg + 2 mg + 50 mg (LLC "Valeant", Russia). Administered per 1 lozenge, with an interval 2 hours or more, up to 6 lozenges per day, for a maximum 5 days or until full illness resolution.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The trial included a screening period, up to 5 days active treatment, and follow-up visit. The patients had to visit the trial site up to 3 times.

group.title: ANGAL
group.description: Patients received Angal, lozenges, per 1 lozenge, with an interval 2 hours or more, 6-10 lozenges per day, for a maximum 4 days or until full illness resolution, if happened earlier than 4th day of treatment.

group.title: ANTIANGIN
group.description: Patients received ANTIANGIN ® FORMULA, 1 lozenge, with an interval 2 hours or more, up to 6 lozenges per day, for a maximum 5 days or until full illness resolution, if happened earlier than 5th day of treatment.

group.title: ANGAL
group.description: Patients received Angal, lozenges, per 1 lozenge, with an interval 2 hours or more, 6-10 lozenges per day, for a maximum 4 days or until full illness resolution, if happened earlier than 4th day of treatment.

group.title: ANTIANGIN
group.description: Patients received ANTIANGIN ® FORMULA, 1 lozenge, with an interval 2 hours or more, up to 6 lozenges per day, for a maximum 5 days or until full illness resolution, if happened earlier than 5th day of treatment.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Without Sore Throat According to TSS Score
outcome.population: ITT, only patients with measurements were included (115 for Angal, and 112 for Antiangin)

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: two-sided 95% CIs estimation used to confirm non-inferior efficacy in primary endpoint. A non-inferiority conclusion was made relating to the primary parameter only.

outcome.title: 50% Reduction Tss SCORE
outcome.description: Frequency of 50 % or more total score reduction by the TSS questionnaire completed by the Investigator relative to baseline in both Angal and ANTI-ANGIN FORMULA arms at visit 2
outcome.population: PP set was considered for the analysis, however only the number of patients with complete data at visit 2 were considered for the analysis

measure.description: Frequency of 50 % or more total score reduction by the TSS questionnaire completed by the Investigator relative to baseline in both Angal and ANTI-ANGIN FORMULA arms at visit 2
measure.population: PP set was considered for the analysis, however only the number of patients with complete data at visit 2 were considered for the analysis

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However Novartis does not prohibit any inversdtigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
